linkTarget.anchoringText: Well completion techniques include both stimulated and unstimulated openhole and pre-perforated liners, to a myriad of modern multistage hydraulic fracture completions. Current completions typically include a 10,000 ft horizontal leg drilled through a continuous pay zone and propped hydraulic fracture stimulated in 20 to 100 mechanically isolated compartments. To date over 10,000 completions have been executed in the Bakken/Three Forks, with the geographic extent shown in Fig. 1.

image-wrap.label: Figure 1
image-wrap.caption: Map of Williston Basin Bakken/Three Forks dataset.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Map of Williston Basin Bakken/Three Forks dataset.

linkTarget.anchoringText: As a result of enhanced quality control of developed macro datasets, a true 92 comparative recompletions have been identified, with 49 reentry and 43 refracturing efforts. The remaining difference (and large amounts of previously categorized refracturing treatments) actually exist as problem-well remediation cases. As the budgets to execute within these three categories have reported as much as a 26-fold variance in recompletion cost, a strict comparison of these individual bins will be used in this analysis. Fig. 2 is a map geospatial showing the sample refracture and reentry wells in the dataset.

image-wrap.label: Figure 2
image-wrap.caption: Map of Bakken/Three Forks Recompletion dataset.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Map of Bakken/Three Forks Recompletion dataset.

linkTarget.anchoringText: Fig. 3 illustrates this by comparing the zone area stimulation intensity of the completion versus the 12-month BOE divided by the oil to liquid ratio. The production metric is 12-month BOE divided by the oil-to-liquid ratio. Gangiredla and Westacott (2014) presented this quantum as a uniform measure of induced flow capacity across a discontinuous oil-to-liquid ratio within the Williston basin Bakken/Three Forks play.

image-wrap.label: Figure 3
image-wrap.caption: Completion and stimulation intensity versus production. Wells completed with 8,000 – 10,500 ft of lateral pay length.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Completion and stimulation intensity versus production. Wells completed with 8,000 – 10,500 ft of lateral pay length.

linkTarget.anchoringText: Fig. 4 is a comparison of Fig. 3 with recompletion wells marked in the bottom and outer right bounding plots. It is notable that the reentry wells were initially completed with large zone areas, single stage openhole laterals, and were first quartile initial performers. These wells exist in the lower right quadrant of the primary plot in Fig. 4.

image-wrap.label: Figure 4
image-wrap.caption: Recompletion dataset (bottom and outer right) relative to the primary completion and stimulation intensity (top left).

formatted-caption.caption-text: Recompletion dataset (bottom and outer right) relative to the primary completion and stimulation intensity (top left).

linkTarget.anchoringText: In assessing refracturing performance, two distinct bins related to well constriction and primary completion became apparent. The first bin includes wells with mechanically compartmentalized original stimulation treatments ranging from 180-1500 ft in zone length. Within this grouping, Fig. 5 is an example of a top performing refracturing treatment, with Fig. 6 an example of a bottom performer. For clarity with regard to Figs. 5-10, the star data point on each plot represents an executed recompletion type.

image-wrap.label: Figure 5
image-wrap.caption: Fourth quartile refracturing performance.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Fourth quartile refracturing performance.

image-wrap.label: Figure 10
image-wrap.caption: Remediation consisting of refracturing and adding new previously unstimulated pay.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Remediation consisting of refracturing and adding new previously unstimulated pay.

linkTarget.anchoringText: Fig. 5 had a higher completion and stimulation intensity than Fig. 6, as illustrated in Fig. 3. The post refracture production for Fig. 5 is far more prolific than Fig. 6, providing evidence that merely choosing to refracture a well based upon initial completion design is a naïve approach. Rate transient analysis can provide an inherent measure of the completion effectiveness. One useful indicator of the flow regime within the reservoir is the slope of log-log rate versus time plot, as were shown in Figs. 5 and 6 and later in Figs. 7 through 11.

image-wrap.label: Figure 11
image-wrap.caption: Intervention driven remediation value.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Intervention driven remediation value.

linkTarget.anchoringText: The inadequacy of these two measures is shown in Figs. 12 through 13, which compare these two metrics to the actual volume of hydrocarbons produced 12-months after recompletion. Although some trends are apparent when examining all recompletions in aggregate (as in Fig. 12), the trends evaporate when viewed categorically (as in Fig. 13). Additionally, the post-recompletion peak production occurs within the first 30 days for only 74% of project wells, as shown in Fig. 14.

image-wrap.label: Figure 12
image-wrap.caption: Crossplot of common recompletion metrics.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Crossplot of common recompletion metrics.

linkTarget.anchoringText: The inadequacy of these two measures is shown in Figs. 12 through 13, which compare these two metrics to the actual volume of hydrocarbons produced 12-months after recompletion. Although some trends are apparent when examining all recompletions in aggregate (as in Fig. 12), the trends evaporate when viewed categorically (as in Fig. 13). Additionally, the post-recompletion peak production occurs within the first 30 days for only 74% of project wells, as shown in Fig. 14.

linkTarget.anchoringText: The inadequacy of these two measures is shown in Figs. 12 through 13, which compare these two metrics to the actual volume of hydrocarbons produced 12-months after recompletion. image-wrap.label: Figure 14
image-wrap.caption: Time to post-recompletion peak production, refracture, and reentry.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Time to post-recompletion peak production, refracture, and reentry.

linkTarget.anchoringText: Fig. 15 is a bubble map geospatially showing wells that were analyzed with more than 360 producing days post refracture. The most prolific 12-month post refracture production has been achieved towards the depocenter of the basin. The P50 cumulative production results in Dunn County, ND were 56,222 BOE; 45,826 BOE in Mountrail County, ND; 38,145 BOE in McKenzie County, ND; and 31,850 BOE in Williams County, ND.

image-wrap.label: Figure 15
image-wrap.caption: Map of Bakken/Three Forks Refracture Treatments sized by 12-month BOE post Refracture.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Map of Bakken/Three Forks Refracture Treatments sized by 12-month BOE post Refracture.

linkTarget.anchoringText: Fig. 16 is a bubble map geospatially showing 40 active reentry wells of similar methodology that were analyzed from the initial vetted dataset of 49 wells, parsed to be independent of significant remediation efforts. The most prolific reentry P50 results have been achieved in Mountrail County, ND. The P50 12-month cumulative production yielded 144,587 BOE, whilst McKenzie County, ND has a P50 of 101,471 BOE and Dunn County, ND with P50 of 80,500 BOE.

image-wrap.label: Figure 16
image-wrap.caption: Map of Bakken/Three Forks Reentry Treatments sized by 12-month BOE post Reentry.

formatted-caption.caption-text: Map of Bakken/Three Forks Reentry Treatments sized by 12-month BOE post Reentry.

linkTarget.anchoringText: A histogram of incremental production calculated from the actual production minus pre-recompletion forecast is presented in Fig. 17. These results demonstrate significant uplift in production and ultimate recovery. A properly engineered program that minimizes the risks associated with reentry has the potential to increase PDP reserves and add net present value to the asset.

image-wrap.label: Figure 17
image-wrap.caption: Histogram of 12-month incremental BOE (left) and cumlative distribution of 12-month actual BOE (right).

formatted-caption.caption-text: —Histogram of 12-month incremental BOE (left) and cumlative distribution of 12-month actual BOE (right).

figure-specific-caption.caption-text: and cumlative distribution of 12-month actual BOE

linkTarget.anchoringText: If completions with large zone areas are perceived to have bypassed pay, one could test the concept that wells initially completed with large zone areas will be the best recompletion performers. The bottom plot of Fig. 18 is a cross plot of 12-month incremental BOE post recompletion versus primary completion zone area. What is notable is that there is no significant correlation between initial zone area and refracture performance.

image-wrap.label: Figure 18
image-wrap.caption: Completion and stimulation intensity versus post recompletion 12-month incremental BOE: recompletion zone area (top) and primary completion zone area (bottom).

formatted-caption.caption-text: Completion and stimulation intensity versus post recompletion 12-month incremental BOE: recompletion zone area (top) and primary completion zone area (bottom).

figure-specific-caption.caption-text: Completion and stimulation intensity versus post recompletion 12-month incremental BOE: recompletion zone area

linkTarget.anchoringText: Figs. 19, 20, 22, 24 display crossplot relationships between primary completion, recompletion, reservoir production properties, and reservoir production performance. For equivalency in the dataset, remediation treatments that principally encompass the previously defined elements of refracturing or reentry are included to provide the fully rounded 93 well dataset initially defined as refracturing or reentry.

linkTarget.anchoringText: In Fig. 25, a cross validation of post recompletion production to the first 12-months of production is shown. Fig. 25 suggests wells that are initially good performers trend toward higher post recompletion production. A common perception in the industry is to add production to underperforming wells by recompleting.

image-wrap.label: Figure 25
image-wrap.caption: First completion 12-month BOE versus post recompletion 12-month incremental BOE.

formatted-caption.caption-text: First completion 12-month BOE versus post recompletion 12-month incremental BOE.
